snippet: Entering Saturday’s game against North Carolina, No. 1 Clemson has done much on the football field in recent years to be disassociated with the unfortunate coinage “Clemsoning.”
abstract: Marc Tracy On College Football column; undefeated Clemson aims to win Atlantic Coast Conference championship game against North Carolina; should they lose, however, and miss out on College Football Playoff berth, many would describe loss as 'Clemsoning'--word used in football when team suffers inexplicable loss to inferior opponent.
lead_paragraph: Entering Saturday’s game against North Carolina, No. 1 Clemson has done much on the football field in recent years to be disassociated with the unfortunate coinage “Clemsoning.”

headline.print_headline: 12-0, but Dogged by a Disparaging Word
headline.main: For Clemson in A.C.C. Title Game, Expectations Go Both Ways
